result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce D Hurda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Bruce D Hurda appeared in court, Attorney Michal James Peterson appeared in court for Bruce D Hurda, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for Lukas Steiner DA. 

State is moving to amend to OWI 3rd, without minor passenger.
State will recommend 125 days jail, fine of $1,800.00 plus costs, and revocation. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant plead guilty to amended charge. Court accepts the defendants plea of guilty and moves forward with sentencing. 

DA is heard on sentence. 
Atty Peterson is heard on sentence. 

Court orders 125 days jail. 4 days of sentence credit. Huber/electronic monitoring granted after 48 hours. Defendant entitled to good time. DL revocation of 30 months. 
Fine of $1,800.00 plus cost. Cost and Surcharges $1,464.00. $120.00 blood draw. Total owed $3,384.00. Order for Alcohol assessment and driver safety plan and IID for 24 months. 60DTP
$250.00 bond to be applied. Defendant remanded from court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:07 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Attorney Michal James Peterson appeared in court for Bruce D Hurda, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for Lukas Steiner DA. 
Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Information filed.  Information brought over.  Court reviews the information with the defendant.  
Atty Peterson is ready to proceed today,  Def plead not guilty. Clerk to enter not guilty plea into the record.
Jury status hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hrg & Order to Bind Over

11:00 AM Defendant Bruce D Hurda appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Lukas Steiner DA appeared by video. 
     Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.  Def. states understanding.
     Court schedules for an adjourned initial hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
     Court concludes at 11:04 a.m.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Bruce D Hurda
Current: P.O. Box 20, 217 State Highway 27, Seneca, WI 54654   (Effective: 01-07-2022)
Prior: 217 State Highway 27, Seneca, WI 54654

1:15 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated:  Defendant Bruce Daniel Hurda appeared by video, in custody, Plaintiff Luke Steiner Att appeared by video. 
Court finds probable cause. DA Requests $250.00 Cash Bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 
Court orders $250.00 Cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 
Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for January 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
